seniority_level.evidence: Title includes "SR" (Senior) Data Engineer; no years specified but senior title implies senior level.

job_family.evidence: Job title and responsibilities focus on ETL pipelines, data architecture, and warehouse/lakehouse design.

sub_specialty.evidence: Responsibilities emphasize designing ETL processes, lakehouse/warehouse architecture, and using Azure Data Factory – typical batch data‑engineering work.

leadership_expectation.evidence: Senior role with autonomy and responsibility for architecture, but no mention of direct reports or people‑management duties.

primary_cloud.evidence: Must‑have skills list includes Microsoft Fabric, Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory – all Azure services.

secondary_clouds.evidence: No other cloud providers are mentioned in the posting or extraction.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Focus on ETL development, lakehouse/warehouse design, and Azure Data Factory – all batch‑oriented tools.

orchestrator_category.evidence: Extraction does not list any orchestrator (e.g., Airflow, Luigi, dbt, etc.).

storage_layer.evidence: Job description mentions both Lakehouse and Data Warehouse solutions, indicating use of both lake and warehouse storage patterns.

remote_restriction.evidence: ext_geo_restriction_type = "us_only" with allowed country US and state restriction AR (Arkansas).

timezone_focus.evidence: Location is in the United States (Arkansas), placing the role in the Americas time zones.

relocation_required.evidence: Posting offers hybrid or remote work and does not mention any relocation requirement.

h1b_friendly.evidence: ext_visa_sponsorship_stated = "not_mentioned"; no sponsorship language appears in the posting.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of OPT/CPT or student visa eligibility; work authorization is implied for US candidates.

citizenship_required.evidence: No explicit citizenship requirement; only US‑only location implies need for legal work authorization in the US.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Contract type is "permanent" with full‑time employee benefits listed, indicating a W‑2 employment model.

benefits_level.evidence: Benefits include health insurance, vacation days, birthday off, periodic day‑offs, internet reimbursement, food vouchers, extended paternity leave, and technical training – a solid standard package but no equity or premium perks.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Posting mentions "ambiente colaborativo, con foco en tu crecimiento profesional" but provides no concrete career ladder or track details.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Collaborative environment and interaction with business areas suggest informal mentorship, but no formal program is described.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No language about promotions, ladders, or moving to higher titles appears in the posting.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: The description does not reference internal transfers or mobility opportunities.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No explicit mention of IC, management, specialist, or architect tracks.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear must‑have hard and soft skills list, with a short nice‑to‑have list, indicating a balanced but not overly strict set of requirements.

scope_definition.evidence: Job description is focused on data‑engineering responsibilities (ETL, architecture, lakehouse/warehouse) without mixing other roles.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Skill set (Azure Fabric, Synapse, ADF, SQL, Python, DAX) aligns with a senior data‑engineer role; no unrealistic senior‑level expectations for a junior candidate.
